questions.question: Mammoth hotsprings unique travertine terraces are formed of what type of sedimentary rock? Hint: These terraces resemble a cave inside out.
The 45th parallel is a geographic marker that passes through Yellowstone and is marked on the road between the North Entrance and Mammoth.  What position on the globe does it denote?
options: It's half way between the North Pole and the Equator.
It is the hydrological divide where the water on each side drains into a different ocean.
It is 45 degrees from the prime meridian.
It is 45 degrees from the international dateline.

questions.question: Elk herds gather in the Mammoth Hot Springs area for the mating season in
Visitors to the north entrance to Yellowstone pass through the Roosevelt Arch on their way to Mammoth Hot Springs.  The arch was named for President Theodore Roosevelt because he:
